title.narrative: Implementation of Housing NAMA in Mexico

description.narrative: The project supports the implementation of the Sustainable Housing NAMA. It promotes the penetration of energy efficiency (EE) standards in the entire new housing market through technical assistance to large public housing financiers and private developers, as well as financial incentives to small and medium-sized developers and financial intermediaries. It also promotes the upgrading of EE standards and thereby contributes to the transformation of the residential housing sector to a sustainable one where ambitious EE technologies have penetrated the market. The project also generates important co-benefits: improved comfort and living conditions of the residents, lower fiscal outlays for energy subsidies, and the growth and technological leapfrogging of the construction sector. It is expected that the financial cooperation component of this project will mobilise EUR 80-120 m in private investments for the construction of low carbon houses in seven years.
